bedslider 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Sliding application of functions over bed file

Source: R/bed_slide.R
bed_slide.Rd

Sliding application of functions over bed file

bed_slide(data, vars, funs, .i, size)

Arguments

data

Data.frame
vars

list of variable names. Must be supplied in the form list(a, b, d).
funs

List of functions to be applied to the region. See details for more.
.i

Name of the variable denoting the location.
size

Size of the sliding window. The window will be centered around each site.

Value

The original data set with a column added for each fuction in funs.

Details

The region that the funs will be applied to is a matrix with a column for each sample and a row for each row.

Examples

bed_slide(bed_sample,
          vars = list(beta1, beta2, beta3, beta4, beta5),
          funs = list(length, mean),
          .i = start, size = 100)
#> # A tibble: 10,000 x 11
#>    chr    start    end coverage beta1 beta2 beta3 beta4 beta5 length  mean
#>    <fct>  <int>  <int>    <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 chr19 433511 433512        3     1  0     1     1     0.33     20 0.584
